config.question: What was the main purpose of Parliament’s passage of the Tea Act in 1773?

choices.content: to privilege the East India Company, saving it from bankruptcy
to discontinue the increasingly unpopular tax levied on Americans for tea, thus addressing one of the main points of contention with the colonists
to raise revenues for the British government in order to pay off the debts it incurred in the Seven Years’ War
to provide a shrill defense of its supremacy of the Parliament over the Americans “in all cases whatsoever”

answer_3.response: The Parliament enacted the Tea Act because it wanted to save one of Britain’s largest businesses, the East India Company, from bankruptcy. If all had gone according to plan, the agents of the East India Company in America would have undersold their competitors, including the Dutch smugglers, and the new profits would have saved the company.
